column4: hello, does anybody know how to make gnome-panel display no icons?
you should be able to remove everything that's on it
okay, I need to be more specific. I want the application-list applet display text only
I don't know how you would do that. You can install a different menu applet, or a different panel app...
you're sure it works? I've just checked it and there is no option of displaying window list without icons
oh I'm not sure of anything, that was just an example. I've used different panels before, and from what I remember of xfce there were no icons in the menus. I could be wrong tho
you said application list earlier not window list
no, I mean the app that shows you currently opened apps
ooh. I take it back. not sure
well, with open source nothing is impossible. It's just a matter of scale
geez, it shuld be simple, there's such an option on fluxbox e.g.
it should be. I think you should ask  Mark McLoughlin <mark@skynet.ie> to add that feature. I'd like to see it too.
why Mark? window-list applet shows Alexander Larsson as the author
I was looking at window selector applet
